tit.j: 北大路バスターミナル

sen.j: 北大路バスターミナル（きたおおじバスターミナル）は、京都市北区にある京都市営バスのバスターミナル。
sen.e: Located in Kita Ward of Kyoto City, Kitaoji Bus Terminal is a bus terminal of Kyoto City Bus.
Located in Kita Ward of Kyoto City, Kitaoji Bus Terminal is a bus terminal of Kyoto City Bus.
Located in Kita-ku Ward of Kyoto City, Kitaoji Bus Terminal is a bus terminal of Kyoto City Bus.

sen.j: 京都市営地下鉄烏丸線北大路駅に隣接し、京都市営バス烏丸営業所と一体となってキタオオジタウンの地下にある。
sen.e: Adjacent to Kitaoji Station of Kyoto City Subway Karasuma Line, it is in the basement of Kitaoji Town jointly with Kyoto City Bus Karasuma Office.
Adjacent to Kitaoji Station of Kyoto City Subway Karasuma Line, it is in the basement of Kitaoji Town jointly with Kyoto City Bus Karasuma Office.
Adjacent to Kitaoji Station of Kyoto City Subway Karasuma Line, it is in the basement of Kitaoji Town jointly with Kyoto City Bus Karasuma Office.

sen.j: 立地
sen.e: Location
Location
Location

sen.j: 北大路通と烏丸通の北西角（厳密には一筋西）にあり、京都市電の烏丸車庫の時代から北大路通のランドマークとなっている。
sen.e: It is at the corner of Kitaoji-dori Street and Karasuma-dori Street (precisely, a block to the west), and it has been the landmark of Kitaoji-dori Street since it was Karasuma Shako (carbarn) of Kyoto City Trams.

It is at the corner of Kitaoji-dori Street and Karasuma-dori Street (precisely, a block to the west), and it has been the landmark of Kitaoji-dori Street since it was Karasuma Shako (carbarn) of Kyoto City Trams.

It is at the northwest corner of Kitaoji-dori Street and Karasuma-dori Street (precisely, a block to the west), and it has been the landmark of Kitaoji-dori Street since it was Karasuma Shako (carbarn) of Kyoto City Trams.

sen.j: そのため、京都では南北と東西の通りの名前を合わせて烏丸北大路と呼ぶべき周辺地域が、この呼び方はほとんど使われず「北大路バスターミナル」あるいは「北大路駅」とする。
sen.e: Although this district should be called 'Karasuma Kitaoji' as a neighborhood name is usually made by connecting a north-south street name and an east-west street name in Kyoto, this name is rarely used, but it is called 'Kitaoji Bus Terminal,' or 'Kitaoji Station.'

Although this district should be called 'Karasuma Kitaoji' as a neighborhood name is usually made by connecting a north-south street name and an east-west street name in Kyoto, this name is rarely used, but it is called 'Kitaoji Bus Terminal,' or 'Kitaoji Station.'

Although this district should be called 'Karasuma Kitaoji' as a neighborhood name is usually made by connecting a north-south street name and an east-west street name in Kyoto, this name is rarely used, but it is called 'Kitaoji Bus Terminal,' or 'Kitaoji Station.'

sen.j: 世代によっては今でも「烏丸車庫」が通じる。
sen.e: Karasuma Shako' still goes across people of an older generation.
Karasuma Shako' still used by the older generation.
Karasuma Shako' still used by the older generation.

sen.j: 地上部は市電の烏丸車庫を経て市バス烏丸営業所、地下鉄烏丸線北大路駅（竹田駅延長までは地下鉄車両の検査設備併設）であったが、経営改善のため車庫用地の有効活用を目的として大規模商業施設が建設された。
sen.e: Its building above ground used to be a carbarn of the City Streetcars, and was later turned to the City Bus Karasuma Office, then to Kitaoji Station of the City Subway Karasuma Line (it had also housed an inspection facility of subway cars until Takeda Station was extended), but now large-scale commercial facilities have been built there in order to effectively utilize the old carbarn site as one of the management reforms.

Its building above ground used to be a carbarn for the City Streetcars, and was later turned into the Karasuma City Bus Office, then into City Subway Karasuma Line Kitaoji Station (it had also housed an inspection facility for subway cars until Takeda Station was extended), but now large-scale commercial facilities have been built there in order to effectively utilize the old carbarn site as one of the management reforms.

Its building above ground used to be a carbarn for the City Streetcars, and was later turned into the Karasuma City Bus Office, then into City Subway Karasuma Line Kitaoji Station (it had also housed an inspection facility for subway cars until Takeda Station was extended), but now large-scale commercial facilities have been built there in order to effectively utilize the old carbarn site as one of the management reforms.

sen.j: 運営は第三セクターのキタオオジタウン、テナントにはビブレ（北大路ビブレ）やコナミスポーツライフなどが入っている。
sen.e: They are operated by Kitaoji Town, a third-sector company, and VIVRE (Kitaoji VIVRE) and Konami Sports & Life are among the tenants.
They are operated by Kitaoji Town, a third-sector company, and VIVRE (Kitaoji VIVRE) and Konami Sports & Life are among the tenants.
They are operated by Kitaoji Town, a third-sector company, and VIVRE (Kitaoji VIVRE) and Konami Sports & Life are among the tenants.

sen.j: 沿革
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 1981年5月 - 京都市営地下鉄烏丸線開業に合わせ、京都市営バス烏丸営業所敷地内に開設
sen.e: May 1981: the bus terminal was set up in the site of Kyoto City Bus Karasuma Office when Kyoto City Subway Karasuma Line started service.
May 1981: the bus terminal was set up in the site of Kyoto City Bus Karasuma Office when Kyoto City Subway Karasuma Line started service.
May 1981: The bus terminal was set up in the site of Kyoto City Bus Karasuma Office when Kyoto City Subway Karasuma Line started service.

sen.j: 1994年 - 京都市交通局の所有地有効活用を目的としたバス営業所用地再開発によりキタオオジタウンの地下に移転
sen.e: In 1994: it was moved to the basement of Kitaoji Town under the redevelopment of the City Bus Office site with the aim of effective utilization of Kyoto Transportation Bureau's properties.
In 1994: it was moved to the basement of Kitaoji Town under the redevelopment of the City Bus Office site with the aim of effective utilization of Kyoto Transportation Bureau's properties.
1994: It was moved to the basement of Kitaoji Town under the redevelopment of the City Bus Office site with the aim of effective utilization of Kyoto Transportation Bureau's properties.

sen.j: 施設
sen.e: Facilities
Facilities
Facilities

sen.j: 北大路通の北側にあり、バスはスロープを降りて地下2階に進入する。
sen.e: Since it stands at the north side of Kitaoji-dori Street, buses enter to the second basement using a slope way.

sen.j: 入ってすぐの「バスおりば」は烏丸営業所の系統が停車し、降車扱い、乗務員交代、時間調整、場合によっては運転打ち切りなどをする。
sen.e: Inside behind its entrance is 'Bus Oriba' (getting-off zone), at which buses managed by Karasuma Office stop, buses are emptied, drivers are changed, buses kill time, and sometimes operations of some routes are canceled here for the day.

Inside behind its entrance is 'Bus Oriba' (getting-off zone), at which buses managed by Karasuma Office stop, buses are emptied, drivers are changed, buses kill time, and sometimes operations of some routes are canceled here for the day.

Inside behind its entrance is 'Bus Oriba' (getting-off zone), at which buses managed by Karasuma Office stop, buses are emptied, drivers are changed, buses kill time, and sometimes operations of some routes are canceled here for the day.

sen.j: 京都市営バス九条営業所、京都市営バス西賀茂営業所などの営業所の系統はここには停車せず「のりば」に直行する。
sen.e: Buses under Kyoto City Bus Kujo Office and Nishigamo Office directly go to 'Noriba' (boarding zone) without stopping here.
Buses under Kyoto City Bus Kujo Office and Nishigamo Office directly go to 'Noriba' (boarding zone) without stopping here.
Buses under Kyoto City Bus Kujo Office and Nishigamo Office directly go to 'Noriba' (boarding zone) without stopping here.

sen.j: 「おりば」からバスが180度向きを変えた所にある乗り場は「赤のりば」がAからD、「青のりば」がEからGの3つがある。
sen.e: From here buses turn around 180 degrees to reach 'Noriba' which has 'Aka Noriba' (literally, red boarding gates), A through D, and 'Ao Noriba' (literally, blue boarding gates), E through G, three gates each.

From here buses turn around 180 degrees to reach 'Noriba' which has 'Aka Noriba' (literally, red boarding gates), A through D, and 'Ao Noriba' (literally, blue boarding gates), E through G, three gates each.

From here buses turn around 180 degrees to reach 'Noriba' which has 'Aka Noriba' (literally, red boarding gates), A through D, and 'Ao Noriba' (literally, blue boarding gates), E through G, three gates each.

sen.j: 相互は地下3階に降りて連絡する。
sen.e: The third basement connects these two kinds of gates.
The third basement connects these two kinds of gates.
The third basement connects these two kinds of gates.

sen.j: 東にある赤のりばは北大路通を東へ向かう路線、西にある青のりばは西へ向かう路線が停車する。
sen.e: Aka Noriba' on the east is for the routes eastward through Kitaoji-dori Street, and 'Ao Noriba' on the west is for the routes westward.
Aka Noriba' on the east is for the routes eastward through Kitaoji-dori Street, and 'Ao Noriba' on the west is for the routes westward.
Aka Noriba' on the east is for the routes eastward through Kitaoji-dori Street, and 'Ao Noriba' on the west is for the routes westward.

sen.j: 地下3階は連絡通路、定期券発売所、案内所、京都市証明書発行コーナー、地下鉄連絡通路がある。
sen.e: On the third basement are an access way, a commuter pass wicket, an information counter, Kyoto City certificates issuing corner, and a passage to the subway station.
On the third basement level are an access way, a commuter pass wicket, an information counter, Kyoto City certificates issuing corner, and a passage to the subway station.
On the third basement level are an access way, a commuter pass wicket, an information counter, Kyoto City certificates issuing corner, and a passage to the subway station.

sen.j: 烏丸営業所はおりばに隣接して操車室や乗務員控室があり、バスの走行経路でいうと奥、方角では北に車庫があり、一部は地上に設備を有する。
sen.e: This Karasuma Office houses a dispatcher room, a drivers' waiting room adjacent to 'Oriba', a garage behind the bus route and at the north side, and a part of it is above ground.
This Karasuma Office houses a dispatcher room, a drivers' waiting room adjacent to 'Oriba', a garage behind the bus route and at the north side, and part of it is above ground.
This Karasuma Office houses a dispatcher room, a drivers' waiting room adjacent to Oriba, a garage behind the bus route and at the north side, and part of it is above ground.

Routes

sen.j: すべて京都市バスの路線である。
sen.e: Its all routes are of Kyoto City Bus.
All are Kyoto City Bus routes.
All are Kyoto City Bus routes.

sen.j: バスターミナルの前の通りに路線がある京都バスは現在乗り入れていない（後述）。
sen.e: Kyoto Bus has a route that runs on the street in front of this Bus Terminal, but it dose not use the terminal now.
Kyoto Bus has a route that runs in front of this Bus Terminal, but it dose not use the terminal now.

sen.j: この地域に路線のあるバス事業者はこの2者のみである。
sen.e: Only these two bus companies have operating routes in this district.
Only these two bus companies have operating routes in this district.
Only these two bus companies have operating routes in this district.

sen.j: 長距離バスはこの地域には運行されていない。
sen.e: Long-distance coaches do not run through this district.

sen.j: 京都バス
sen.e: Kyoto Bus
Kyoto Bus
Kyoto Bus

sen.j: 1990年に大原行の市バス北6号系統の移管を受けた京都バスの大原方面系統（京都バス高野営業所小出石線）が乗り入れを開始したが、2002年に国際会館駅発着へ移行する形で廃止された。
sen.e: In 1990, the City Bus North No.6 Route for Ohara was transferred to Kyoto Bus, and this route of Kyoto Bus for Ohara (Kodeishi Line of Kyoto Bus Takano Office) began using this terminal, but it ended in 2002 when the route's terminal was moved to Kokusai Kaikan Station (a subway station close to Kyoto International Conference Center).

In 1990, the City Bus North No.6 Route for Ohara was transferred to Kyoto Bus, and this route of Kyoto Bus for Ohara (Kodeishi Line of Kyoto Bus Takano Office) began using this terminal, but it ended in 2002 when the route's terminal was moved to Kokusai Kaikan Station (a subway station close to Kyoto International Conference Center).

In 1990, the City Bus North No.6 Route for Ohara was transferred to Kyoto Bus, and this route of Kyoto Bus for Ohara (Kodeishi Line of Kyoto Bus Takano Office) began using this terminal, but it ended in 2002 when the route's terminal was moved to Kokusai Kaikan Station.
sen.cmt: 半角にし表現を変えました。

sen.j: 北大路通を運行する京都バスの系統は、他にも出町柳駅を起点に市原、静原、雲ヶ畑などへの路線があるが、北大路通の「北大路駅」バス停に停車し、当バスターミナルへの乗り入れは行っていない。
sen.e: Other routes of Kyoto Bus that run through Kitaoji-dori Street are routes that start at Demachiyanagi Station and bound for Ishihara, Shizuhara, and Kumogahata, but their buses stop at 'Kitaoji Eki' bus stop on Kitaoji-dori Street without running into this terminal.

Other routes of Kyoto Bus that run through Kitaoji-dori Street are routes that start at Demachiyanagi Station and are bound for Ishihara, Shizuhara, and Kumogahata, but their buses stop at 'Kitaoji Eki' bus stop on Kitaoji-dori Street without running into this terminal.

Other routes of Kyoto Bus that run through Kitaoji-dori Street are routes that start at Demachiyanagi Station and are bound for Ishihara, Shizuhara, and Kumogahata, but their buses stop at 'Kitaoji Station' bus stop on Kitaoji-dori Street without running into this terminal.

sen.j: 京都府立植物園 最寄りバス停は隣の植物園前
sen.e: The Kyoto Botanical Garden: its closest bus stop is 'Shokubutsuen-mae.'
The Kyoto Botanical Garden: its closest bus stop is 'Shokubutsuen-mae.'
The Kyoto Botanical Garden: Its closest bus stop is 'Shokubutsuen-mae,' the next stop.

sen.j: 京都市北区役所 最寄りは隣の北大路新町
sen.e: Kyoto City Kita Ward Office: its closest bus stop is 'Kitaoji Shinmachi.'
sen.cmt: 地図によると，バス停の位置は「隣の」という表現には当たらないと思われますので，「隣の」の訳出は省略しました．
sen.e: Kyoto City Kita Ward Office: its closest bus stop is 'Kitaoji Shinmachi.'
